alert.note: Alert for Bath (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 5:09PM EDT until August 25 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath, Fleming and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flemingsburg, Fairview, Hillsboro, Poplar Plains, Oakley, Pebble, Tilton, Grange City, Wyoming, Odessa, Sherburne, Ringos Mills, Goddard, Pecks Ridge, Craintown, Plummers Landing, Sharkey, Bethel, Hilda and Cowan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
